result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua W Kooiman

records.addlTxt: 11:34 AM Cases called: 22CF136, 22CF248, 22CF234 and 22CF233. Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joshua W Kooiman in court.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Joshua W Kooiman. Agreement recited by State. In 22CF136 Right to preliminary hearing recited to defendant. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over. Information filed, reading waived. Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled guilty to count 1 of 22CF136. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. All remaining cases are dismissed and read in. Sentencing statements. Court withheld sentence, placed the defendant on probation for 30 months. Conditions of probation include: 30 days jail, with Huber, no good time. Starts forthwith. $2323.00 fines and costs. 24 month DL revocation and 24 month IID. Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. Submit DNA sample. Maintain absolute sobriety. Not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. No possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages. 179 days sentence credit. Bond on hand will be applied towards costs. 12:05 PM
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 8, 2022 at 11:30 am.

9:13 AM Cases called: 22CF136, 22CF234, 22CF233, and 22CF248. Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Joshua W Kooiman in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Joshua W Kooiman. Matters are resolved. There are some issues with credit. Attorney Bartelt is to see the JA in Br. 3 and get a separate plea/sentencing date. 9:15 AM
Pretrial 5-31-22 at 9:30 am and Return date 6-23-22 at 9:00 am
No contact with C.R.C.. No possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages. Not leave the State of WI w/o prior written court approval. Standard felony conditions.

1:25 PM Cases called: 22CF234 and 22CF233. Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Joshua W Kooiman appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Melville Peter Middleton II appeared by video for Joshua W Kooiman. Waived reading of complaints. Advisement of rights. Bond recommendations. In 22CF233 Court set $250.00 cash bond, with the conditions: No contact with C.R.C. No possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages. Not leave the State of WI w/o prior written court approval. Standard felony conditions. In 22CF234 $500.00 cash bond, with the conditions: No possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages. No contact with E.M.M.. Not leave the State of WI w/o prior written court approval. Standard felony conditions. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived for both cases. 1:39 PM
